title: [BEAM-9027] [SQL] Fix ZetaSQL Byte Literals
body:
Fix ZetaSQL Byte Literals affected by CALCITE-3714 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-9058] Reenable line-too-long linter check.
body:
This PR fixes the regular expression to exclude type annotations from linter line-too-long check. We may also want to reconsider whether type annotations should be excluded from 80 character limit, see BEAM-9058. title: RabbitMq IO Connector Refactor + Bugfixes
body:
## Background My first attempts at using RabbitMq in Beam were quite problematic. Watermarking did not advance as expected, CheckpointMarks would fail as amqp channels could be severed during processing, deduplication of messages was optional but hard-coded to an awkward implementation that only looked at the 'correlation id' amqp property, which isn't necessarily unique. In short, this did not behave like a top-tier IO connector. I had a great Q&A with the Beam Dev DL (see https://www.mail-archive.com/dev@beam.apache.org/msg17149.html ) and I have a pretty substantial refactor ready for review. ## Open Questions I don't know the best process to follow here. This is a lot of change, and there isn't a backing ticket for much (or any) of it right now. Seems like there at least should be. Also, I'm wondering if I could/should be part of the `OWNERS` for this module if this gets merged. It seems there aren't many eyes on rabbitmq IO and I'm happy to help out if I can. ## Changes ***Note** This will not be binary compatible with previous versions of rabbitmq io. End users *will* have to update code. I think given the level of 'not working' I experienced as a user of rabbitmq with beam, this is ok. But we can discuss. I'll break this apart into manageable sections: ### Structural Changes - I've followed the `KafkaIO` connector's convention of separating many of these classes into separate files. It's been very difficult to trace the code with everything in `RabbitMqIo.java`. - Standardized on file/class prefix `RabbitMq` ### RabbitMqIO Changes - I've explicitly dropped support for declaring an exchange. I can't find a valid use case for this with Beam and it's unnecessary code complexity. - More clearly documented supported use cases. - Refactored the API and documentation to drop terminology indicating one 'writes to / reads from an exchange vs writes to / reads from a queue'. In AMQP 0.9, one always writes to an exchange and always reads from a queue. Instead, the caller now just specifies whether the queue already exists (simple use case) or if it may need creating (more complex), with a `ReadParadigm` interface defining this. Similarly, writing is always done to an exchange. `RabbitMqMessage` should already contain an appropriate routing key. - Supports pluggable connection handlers (more on this in `Resource Management` below) - Supports pluggable message deduplication strategies, but a strategy is now required). More on this in `Message Deduplication` below. - Supports total backlog bytes estimation, with some caveats. Mostly stolen from KafkaIO's implementation. - Reworked `RabbitMqMessage` to use AutoValue. ### Message Deduplication - Previously, this was user-toggled. Given CheckpointMark finalizing can fail, this should not be considered an optional operation. `requiresDeduping` is now hard-coded to `true` - Strategy for detecting duplicate messages is pluggable, with several implementations already built-in to choose from. The previous default was the amqp property `correlationId` but this is not a safe choice. Many messages could be correlated to the same upstream event. Amqp property `messageId` would be a better choice, if implemented, but there are others the user can choose from, including `always unique` which effectively disables deduping. ### Resource Management - I borrowed connection management from `JdbcIO` in terms of maintaining a static map of `Connection`s tied to a remote URI. In AMQP, one multiplexes over Connections via Channels. - For better Channel management, each reader and writer now has a unique id (`UUID`) and I use the borrower (or lender) pattern to define what work should be done along the channel, but keep channel/connection management outside of the caller's concern to ensure consistent error handling, recovery, etc. ### Checkpoint Marks ***Assumption** This refactor is oriented around the following assumptions: 1) a CheckpointMark is associated with zero or one current Readers, but no more; 2) a CheckpointMark may outlive a Reader, but the converse is not true. - Dropped support for amqp transactions. They serve no purpose in this streaming model and in general should just be adding overhead. Messages are acknowledged or they aren't; that's transactional enough. - RabbitMqCheckpointMark may outlive a reader, so it's now responsible for closing an active channel if the checkpoint mark is finalized and there are no more reads happening - RabbitMqCheckpointMark is no longer re-used across readers. A new one will be instantiated any time a Reader is instantiated as there's no way safe way to 'recover' a deserialized CheckpointMark and still acknowledge messages. ### Watermarks and Timestamps - I've basically re-implemented a dynamic watermarking strategy based off `Kafka`'s. Like Kafka, I've made the implementation pluggable, with the dynamic `CustomTimestampPolicyWithLimitedDelay` and the default `ProcessingTimePolicy`. ------------------------ I've done some testing in Dataflow and locally and I believe things are behaving correctly and this is in a pretty good state, so I wanted to start soliciting feedback now. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-8685] sdks/java: google_auth_version 0.19.0
body:
Upgrading the following two libraries to 0.19.0. ``` google_auth_library_credentials : "com.google.auth:google-auth-library-credentials:$google_auth_version", google_auth_library_oauth2_http : "com.google.auth:google-auth-library-oauth2-http:$google_auth_version", ``` This is preparation for BEAM-8676 (gax-grpc upgrade); `com.google.api gax:1.52.0` requires `com.google.auth:google-auth-library-oauth2-http:0.19.0` or higher. # Linkage Check ## beam-sdks-java-extensions-google-cloud-platform-core - before: https://gist.github.com/suztomo/aec41839abec689eb379fd9c70575325 - after: https://gist.github.com/suztomo/be1388f48fb13c75813992cab9400067 Diff: ``` suztomo@suxtomo24:~/beam6$ diff /tmp/linkagecheck-beam-sdks-java-extensions-google-cloud-platform-core-785609f2 /tmp/linkagecheck-beam-sdks-java-extensions-google-cloud-platform-core-ea012f73 184c184 < (guava-20.0.jar) com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList's method toImmutableList() is not found; --- > (guava-28.1-android.jar) com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList's method toImmutableList() is not found; ``` The transitive dependency of Guava in beam-sdks-java-extensions-google-cloud-platform-core got higher version (from 20.0 to 28.1-android) but this missing method has been there even for the old version 20.0. ## beam-runners-google-cloud-dataflow-java - before: https://gist.github.com/suztomo/8917ae65a8aa90940b6c090b83d04c0a - after: https://gist.github.com/suztomo/2c0c264f55e44ae6ced36cf6cc4a1114 (same as above) ## beam-examples-kotlin - before: https://gist.github.com/suztomo/fe6008ab53694c82c896f9d6c31e9806 - after: https://gist.github.com/suztomo/66c4494daab25365f0407a156f2a311d (same as above) ## beam-examples-java - before: https://gist.github.com/suztomo/afd80975287007db7800e869c6cb2c54 - after: https://gist.github.com/suztomo/64f9ae4aac13c9c1add0a0c73ac17b17 (same as above) ## beam-sdks-java-extensions-sql-datacatalog Linkage Checker fails to resolve dependencies (Bug: https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/cloud-opensource-java/issues/1087 ). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-9053] Improve error message when unable to get the correct file…
body:
…system for specified path in Python SDK PR to improve the error message when not getting the correct filesystem from the specified path. Getting something more helpful now: "Unable to get filesystem from specified path, please use the correct path or ensure the required dependency is installed, e.g., pip install apache_beam[gcp]. Path specified: %s" ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-7274] Add DynamicMessage Schema support
body:
Add DynamicMessage schema support. This is different from generated classes as it uses the proto descriptors. It uses the ProtoDomain as an index for searching embedded messages. title: [BEAM-5605] Add support for channel splitting to the gRPC read "source" and propagate "split" calls to the downstream receiver
body:
This code mirrors the logic/implementation within [Python](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/16757ef9a6da4d0ac218c6c4d6b19e2a49ccca45/sdks/python/apache_beam/runners/worker/bundle_processor.py#L206). To be able to propagate the split call to the downstream receiver, I collapsed all the harness `FnDataReceiver` types into two existing implementations and one new implementation. The previous hierarchy was: ``` element counting receiver -> time counting receiver -> multiplexing receiver (possibly the original receiver) ``` The current implementation combined the element counting, time counting and multiplexing into the `MultiplexingMetricTrackingFnDataReceiver` while for the singleton case into the `MetricTrackingFnDataReceiver`. To propagate splits, a `SplittingMetricTrackingFnDataReceiver` was created that extends the MetricTrackingFnDataReceiver. Note, like in [Python](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/c167d8ef99b21148bcab7c37538a6ef2f64864c7/sdks/python/apache_beam/runners/worker/operations.py#L133), there is currently no support for splitting a multiplexed consumer. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-8745] More fine-grained controls for the size of a BigQuery Load job
body:
Users have hit problems where load jobs into very wide tables (100s of columns) are very slow, and sometimes fail. Feedback from BigQuery is that for very wide tables, smaller load jobs can avoid failures, and slowdowns. `BigQueryIO` already has the plumbing to support `maxBytesPerPartition`, though there is no public interface to change that parameter from the default. This PR simply promotes this parameter to be public and adds documentation for it. https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-8745 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9049] Add opt-in --shutDownOnThrashing flag
body:
We've seen several Dataflow pipelines fail when multiple workers are shut down due to thrashing while working on the same work item. I believe instead we should make this an opt-in feature that a user can enable when they are concerned about thrashing and are aware of the risks. title: [BEAM-8335] Add the ReverseTestStream
body:
This adds the ReverseTestStream capabilities that takes in a stream of elements and emits the correct TestStreamPayloads to replay the stream. This relies on runners implementing a new primitive called the "PairWithTiming" transform. This takes an element as an input and outputs a new tuple of (element, timing information). Timing information contains the processing time timestamp and watermark. #interactive ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-9041, BEAM-9042] SchemaCoder equals should not rely on from/toRowFunction equality
body:
This PR fixes both issues because (1) one fix depends on the other, and (2) to make it easier to validate/cherry pick into 2.18.0's branch.

BEAM-9041: Don't rely on equality for the from/to functions in `SchemaCoder` because nobody implements equals on `SerializableFunction`. I tried to do this with byte equality, maybe there is a better way to do it but I could not think of another.
BEAM-9042: Since Avro's `Schema` class is not `Serializable` I made it `transient`. Another approach could have been to transform the Schema into a String (not sure if this is needed but I can change it if you think it is worth).

R: @TheNeuralBit

title: [BEAM-9037] Instant and duration as logical type
body:
The proto schema includes Timestamp and Duration with nano precision. The logical types should be promoted to the core logical types, so they can be handled on various IO's as standard mandatory conversions. This means that the logical type should use the proto specific Timestamp and Duration but the java 8 Instant and Duration. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Apex | Dataflow | Flink | Gearpump | Samza | Spark --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | --- | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | --- | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) Java | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-9050] Catch __module__ is None.
body:
The current code crashes when `__module__` is None. According to https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#the-standard-type-hierarchy `__module__` is "The name of the module the function was defined in, or None if unavailable." As a very particular example, Protobuf sets generated type's `__module__` to None: https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/blob/master/python/google/protobuf/message_factory.py#L85 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9020] LengthPrefixUnknownCodersTest to avoid relying on AbstractMap's equality
body:
Fixes https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-9020 . Attempt for BEAM-8695 LengthPrefixUnknownCodersTest failed when trying to upgrade google-http-client to v1.34.0, because LengthPrefixUnknownCodersTest relies on the equality of CloudObject with Map. With that version, GenericData has its own equals method ([PR#589](https://github.com/googleapis/google-http-java-client/pull/589/files#diff-914cd7ff18143b3d2398149e1cfb4f45R218)) that checks classInfo and thus the comparisons between a CloudObject and a Map always fail. Therefore LengthPrefixUnknownCodersTest should not rely on AbstractMap's equality. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9012] Change __init__ hints so they work with pytype
body:
`pytype` doesn't let you omit the `-> None` return type for `__init__` methods, nor does it let you add a hint for just a function's return type (like `# type: (...) -> None`). This PR adds full function signature type hints to the `__init__` methods for `Pipeline` and `PipelineOptions` (so far the only places I've seen issues with pytype parsing these hints). title: [BEAM-9030] Bump grpc to 1.26.0
body:
When submitting a Python word count job to a Flink session/standalone cluster repeatedly, the meta space usage of the task manager of the Flink cluster will continuously increase (about 40MB each time). The reason is that the Beam classes are loaded with the user class loader in Flink and There are problems with the implementation of `ProcessManager`(from Beam) and `ThreadPoolCache`(from netty) which may cause the user class loader could not be garbage collected even after the job finished which causes the meta space memory leak eventually. You can refer to FLINK-15338[1] for more information. Regarding to `ProcessManager`, I have created a JIRA BEAM-9006[2] to track it. Regarding to `ThreadPoolCache`, it is a Netty problem and has been fixed in NETTY#8955[3]. Netty 4.1.35 Final has already included this fix and GRPC 1.22.0 has already dependents on Netty 4.1.35 Final. So this PR is bump the version of GRPC to 1.26.0+ (currently 1.21.0). [1] https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-15338 [2] https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-9006 [3] https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/8955 Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Apex | Dataflow | Flink | Gearpump | Samza | Spark --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | --- | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | --- | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) Java | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-9006] Improve ProcessManager for shutdown hook handling.
body:
In this PR will solve the garbage collection issue as currently the class `ProcessManager` will add a shutdown hook to stop all the living processes before JVM exits. The shutdown hook will never be removed. If this class is loaded by the user class loader, it will cause the user class loader could not be garbage collected which causes meta space memory leak eventually. title: [BEAM-9039] Fix race on reading channel readErr
body:
Close off a race condition where a closing DataChannel might have new readers created for it while it is failing, causing stuckness in the bundles. In particular, the c.readErr must be interacted while c.mu is held. Otherwise something like the following happens. Given a channel C, and goroutines G1,G2. 1. G1 A request for a new reader on C arrives, checks C.readErr finds it null. 2. G2 An error occurs on reading. The lock is acquired, and C.readErr is set. Readers are closed. The channel is officially closed with A.forceRecreate, removing it from the DataManager cache. 3. G1 calls A.makeReader, and creates a new reader there. There could be an arbitrary number of G1s. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9027] [SQL] Fix ZetaSql unparsing bugs
body:
Create a `BeamSqlUnparseContext` to cover `ZetaSQL` specific unparsing syntax. - Implement custom unparsing for `SqlTypeFamily#BINARY` - Unparse binary string to the following format: `B'\x01\x62'` - Floats with a floating part equal to zero are treated as whole (`INT64`). Cast to double when that happens. - Literal strings should escape `\` when unparsed. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Set TMPDIR for tox environments
body:
This affects Python's tempfile module, which should improve performance for tests that scan /tmp. Ex: If a test pipeline writes sharded files to the prefix `/tmp/tmp74ic4z8l` (not a directory, generated via tempfile.mkstemp or tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile), then it will very likely scan the containing directory `/tmp` for files matching the tmp and output file glob pattern (see `FileSystems.match()` calls in `FileBasedSink`). Alternatively: these tests could be fixed to create a subdir in /tmp or periodically clean up /tmp on Jenkins nodes. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-7274] Implement the Protobuf schema provider for compiled protocol buffers
body:
Since compiled protocol buffers have efficient generated getters and builders, we reuse the ByteBuddy framework to create lazy rows that delegate to those methods.

Support for DynamicMessage is in a followon PR.

R: @alexvanboxel

title: [BEAM-8575] Refactor test_do_fn_with_windowing_in_finish_bundle to work with Dataflow runner
body:

Limit input to one single element to enforce that. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-9013] TestStream fix for DataflowRunner
body:
The DataflowRunner relies on the old implementation of the TestStream with only a single output and different watermark controlling mechanices. This adds the _DeprecatedSingleOutputTestStream which allows for any more development of the TestStream to occur in the _TestStream class without breaking backwards compatibility with Dataflow. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9010] Proper TableRow size calculation via TableRowJsonCoder
body:
Fixes https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/BEAM/issues/BEAM-9010 [org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.testing.TableContainer](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/6fa94c9/sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/testing/TableContainer.java#L43) and [org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.bigquery.BigQueryServicesImpl](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/c2f0d28/sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/bigquery/BigQueryServicesImpl.java#L758) should not rely on `toString()` to calculate row size. It should rely on `TableRowJsonCoder`. CC: @reuvenlax ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-8335] On Unbounded Source change
body:
1. Evict all cache when unbounded source changes in a pipeline executed by the InteractiveRunner; 2. Invalidate existing background caching job on unbounded source change; 3. Detects unbounded source addition/deletion/mutation through signature generated from `to_runner_api`; 4. The change detection and following routines are carried out at pipeline execution time. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-9000] Java Test Assertions without toString for GenericJson subclasses
body:
Implementaiton of Option 3 "Check JSON equality via JSONassert" in https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/BEAM/issues/BEAM-9000 As of now, there are many tests that assert on `toString()` of GenericJson subclasses. ``` CounterUpdate result = testObject.transform(monitoringInfo); assertEquals( "{cumulative=true, integer={highBits=0, lowBits=0}, " + "nameAndKind={kind=SUM, " + "name=transformedValue-ElementCount}}", result.toString()); ``` This style is prone to unnecessary maintenance of the test code when upgrading dependencies. Dependencies may change the internal ordering of fields and trivial change in `toString()`. In fact, [BEAM-8695](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-8695) is suspended partly because of these tests. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-9072] [SQL] DataStoreV1 IO connector
body:
Implement `DataStoreV1Table` and `DataStoreV1TableProvder`. DataStoreV1 sends fields in the arbitrary order (when reading from it), current implementation relies on the the Beam schema to determine order when constructing rows. This means that the Beam schema must have the exact same schema as the DataStore `Type` we are reading from (order and field names). Todo: - [x] Replace Conversion map with `switch-case` statements - [x] JavaDoc - [x] Read key ids (optional field `__key__` in row schema of type `VARBINARY`) - [x] Writing back with user-set keys (use one of the fields ex: `__key__`) - When field is `null` or does not exist - use randomly generated id - [x] TableProperty to allow user specify the field to read/write the key into/from (default `__key__`). - [x] Support nested fields - [x] Support arrays (w/ complex types, ex: arrays, rows, etc.) - [x] Support arrays (w/ simple types, ex: int64, String, etc.) - [x] Implement `buildIOWriter` - [x] Implement `getTableStatistics` Proposed design [doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FxuEGewJ3GPDl0IKglfOYf1edwa2m_wryFZYRMpRNbA/edit?pli=1). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-8676] sdks/java: gax and grpc upgrades
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-8676 Gax and gRPC work together. Upgrading their dependencies to higher versions. - The latest gax-grpc:1.52.0 depends on gRPC 1.25.0. (So not setting grpc 1.26.0) # Which modules use gax and grpc? `find . -name 'build.gradle' |xargs grep -ir library.java.gax` gave - ./sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/build.gradle - ./sdks/java/extensions/sql/datacatalog/build.gradle - ./sdks/java/extensions/sql/zetasql/build.gradle # Linkage Check ## beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform - before: - after: ## beam-sdks-java-extensions-sql-zetasql Linkage Checker does not work for beam-sdks-java-extensions-sql-zetasql. (Bug: GoogleCloudPlatform/cloud-opensource-java#1087) ## beam-sdks-java-extensions-sql-datacatalog - before: - after: ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-9009] Add pytest-timeout plugin, set timeout

title: [BEAM-8676] sdks/java: gax and grpc upgrades
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-8676 Gax and gRPC work together. Upgrading their dependencies to higher versions. - The latest gax-grpc:1.52.0 depends on gRPC 1.25.0. (So not setting grpc 1.26.0) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-8951] Stop using nose in load tests
body:
Beam is moving away from nose. We could change the way of running Python load tests: instead of being subclasses of `unittest.TestCase`, they could be plain Python scripts, just like wordcount examples. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-5192] Add support for Elasticsearch v7 in ElasticsearchIO
body:
This PR is based on https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/10010 which was just a start: - tests were not running because of the addition of MockHttpPlugin in ES7 test framework - some ES7 ifs were missed in ESIO code - timeout API was removed so uniformisation among versions was needed in public api. - read output json has changed in ES7 - retry_on_conflict parameter has changed in ES7 - fix dependencies and upgrade versions - removed an irrelevant test See commit log ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Change access for the TableRowJsonCoder constructor
body:
The class TableRowJsonCoder is a singleton, which makes it impossible to subclass to tweak the behavior of the Mapper object in cases where non-standard behavior is desired.
Change the constructor of TableRowJsonCoder from private to protected to allow for subclassing.

R: lukecwik

title: [BEAM-8960]: Add an option for user to opt out of using insert id for BigQuery streaming insert.
body:
Expose an option so that user can opt out of using insert id while streaming into BigQuery. ------------------------ Insert id only guarantees best effort insert rows deduplication, without it, user will be able to opt into using new streaming backend with higher quotas and reliabilities. Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-8996] Auto-generate pipeline options documentation for FlinkRunner
body:
The documentation of the pipeline options on the runner page easily becomes outdated. In order for it to stay up to date, we auto-generate the documentation from the FlinkPipelineOptions class. This is done for both Java and Python. title: Revert "[BEAM-5495] Use ClassGraph to detect classpath resources"
body:
This reverts commit 7e5a885d854eb86b7dd07f778c05fa5d595adc7d. Classgraph seems to suffer some problems tha appeared in post commit testing (see: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/10410). We can switch back to one of previously proposed solutions without reverting the whole branch but only one commit that introduces classgraph. If we decide to merge this revert, the algorithm for resources scanning is as follows: - if possible scan the provided URLClassLoader and list the resources - else, scan the "java.class.path" env variable and list the resources ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9014] CachingShuffleBatchReader use bytes to limit cache size.
body:
Limiting cache size by bytes.

The target batch size is 4MiB but may vary depending on many factors. Using a byte limit for the cache is beneficial,
  * large batches will cause OOMs less often since less will be cached
  * more small batches fit into the cache

title: [BEAM-8962] Report Flink metric accumulator only when pipeline ends
body:
To avoid the runtime overhead of continuously reporting accumulators from the TaskManagers to the JobManager, we can defer the reporting of the metrics accumulator until the pipeline shuts down. A final snapshot of the accumulators will be reported then. This means the metrics will still be available in the PipelineResult. Of course, the metrics reporting via Flink is not affected by this change. title: [BEAM-8695][Not for merge yet] sdks/java: google-http-client 1.34.0
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-8695. Upgrading google-http-client version to the latest 1.34.0. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier).
